title: 52nd parallel north
text:
The 52nd parallel north is a <a href="circle%20of%20latitude">circle of latitude</a> that is 52 <a href="degree%20%28angle%29">degrees</a> <a href="true%20north">north</a> of the <a href="Earth">Earth's</a> <a href="equator">equatorial plane</a>. It crosses <a href="Europe">Europe</a>, <a href="Asia">Asia</a>, the <a href="Pacific%20Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a>, <a href="North%20America">North America</a>, and the <a href="Atlantic%20Ocean">Atlantic Ocean</a>.
In <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, part of the legally defined border between <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a> and <a href="Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Newfoundland and Labrador</a> is defined by the parallel, though Quebec <a href="Labrador%23Boundary%20dispute">maintains a dormant claim</a> to some of the territory north of this line.
The <a href="Catchment%20area%20%28human%20geography%29">catchment area</a> of <a href="London">London</a>, the capital city of <a href="England">England</a> and the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>, can be broadly defined by the <a href="51st%20parallel%20north">51st</a> and 52nd parallels.
At this latitude the <a href="sun">sun</a> is visible for 16 hours, 44 minutes during the <a href="summer%20solstice">summer solstice</a> and 7 hours, 45 minutes during the <a href="winter%20solstice">winter solstice</a>.
Around the world.
Starting at the <a href="Prime%20Meridian">Prime Meridian</a> (just west of the village of <a href="Barkway">Barkway</a> in <a href="Hertfordshire">Hertfordshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>) and heading eastwards, the parallel 52° north passes through:
